full_text: Ber | ee 2019/KER/199 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT EBRNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE K.ABRAHAM MATHEW FRIDAY, THE O4TH DAY OF JANUARY 2019 / 14TH POUSHA, 1940 Crl1.MC.No. 43 of 2019 sc 784/2012 OF ADDL. SESSIONS COURT-IV, THRISSUR CRIME NO. 5911/2012 OF MATHILAKOM POLICE STATION, THRISSUR PETITIONER/S: 1 SHAJAHAN, AGED 42 YEARS $/O ABDHUL KAREEM, KUNNATH HOUSE, PULLUTHU VILLAGE, KOZHIKADA DHESOM, THRISSUR. 2 SHAMEER, AGED 43 YEARS s/o KHALIDH, MULAKKAMPARAMBIL HOUSE, KOTHAPARAMB, S.N.PURAM VILLAGE, THRISSUR. 3 NAZEEMUDHEEN, AGED 38 YEARS s/o KHADER, MANNARAPARAMBIL HOUSE, AZHIKOD VILLAGE, MATHILAKAM, THRISSUR. 4 KUNJIMUHAMMED, AGED 48 YEARS s/o ABOOBACKER, ALLANOOR HOUSE, KAPPAL BAZAR, AZHIKOD VILLAGE, THRISSUR. 5 SANEER, AGED 35 YEARS, s/o SAIDUMUHAMMED, VAYANATTUPADI HOUSE, PATHIYACHERI DHESOM, S.N.PURAM VILLAGE, THRISSUR. BY ADV. SRI.E.A.HARIS RESPONDENT/S: 1 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM 68031. Pie Bie 2019/KER/199 Cri.MC.No. 43 of 2019 ..2.. 2 SHAFEER S/O ABU, AGED 36 YEARS, MANNOTHUMPARAMBIL VEETTIL, KOTHAPARAMB KARA, LOKAMALLESWARAM VILLAGE, MATHILAKAM, THRISSUR.-680685. BY ADV. T.P.ARUN MENON OTHER PRESENT: SRI ALEX M THOMBRA SR PP THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 04.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: ORDER Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C. 2. The petitioners are the accused in SC No. 784 of 2012 on the file of the Additional Sessions Court-IV, Thrissur registered for the offences under Sections 143, 147 & 364 r/w Section 149 of the Indian Penal Code. The second respondent is the victim. It is submitted that the matter has been settled and the proceedings in the criminal case may be quashed. 2019/KER/199 Crl.MC.No. 43 of 2019 1.3.. 3. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners and the second respondent and the learned Public Prosecutor. 4. I have perused the affidavit filed by the second respondent, who has entered appearance through counsel. I am satisfied that the allegation of settlement is true and no public interest is involved. There is no impediment for granting the prayer of the petitioners. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed. The proceedings in SC No. 784 of 2012 on the file of the Additional Sessions Court-IV, Thrissur are quashed. The trial court may pass appropriate orders for the disposal of the material objects, if any, produced in the case. Sd/- K.ABRAHAM MATHEW JUDGE Bka/07.01.2019 Bel BL 2019/KER/199 Cri.MC.No. 43 of 2019 on APPENDIX PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE Al CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN S.C.NO.784/2012 OF ADDITIONAL DISTRICT AND SESSIONS COURT-IV, THRISSUR. ANNEXURE A2 AFFIDAVIT OF THE DEFACTO COMPLAINANT/2ND RESPONDENT.
